channel.title: Custom items
channel.description: hey people im new to server making. i have a server but i dont no how to add drgon plate bodys claws and custom items. could you plz help me with this issue. ty 4 your time.

item.title: Custom items
item.dc:creator: @stickman968 stickman968
item.description:
@stickman968 wrote:

k ty dude ill try it[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 24, 2009, 10:13:56 am[/size][hr]download your models that you want.
Put them in YOUR client at models.
go to class8 and add the ints ( every model shud have it looks like this:
Code:

if(i == 215)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[0] = “Clean”;
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 22418;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 13974;
class8.anInt174 = 13046;
class8.anInt181 = 789;
class8.anInt190 = 581;
class8.anInt198 = 1770;
class8.anInt204 = 97;
class8.anInt169 = 8;
class8.anInt194 = -1;
class8.anInt175 = 57;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.anInt199 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “ItemName”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “Exame Text”.getBytes();
}

something like that, add it in class8. close all & client. save it and compile it.
After compiling run your client.

type IN YOUR CLIENT something like
Code:

add model **** <-- the number shud be the MODEL ID. when you put the models in the map model.

DONT use ::add model **** just add model ****

dosnt work

Read full topic

item.title: Custom items
item.dc:creator: @I_D_D_S_I I D D S I
item.description:
@I_D_D_S_I wrote:

download your models that you want.
Put them in YOUR client at models.
go to class8 and add the ints ( every model shud have it looks like this: if(i == 215) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[0] = "Clean"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 22418; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 13974; class8.anInt174 = 13046; class8.anInt181 = 789; class8.anInt190 = 581; class8.anInt198 = 1770; class8.anInt204 = 97; class8.anInt169 = 8; class8.anInt194 = -1; class8.anInt175 = 57; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.anInt199 = -1; class8.aString170 = "*ItemName*"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Exame Text".getBytes(); }

something like that, add it in class8. close all & client. save it and compile it.
After compiling run your client.

type IN YOUR CLIENT something like add model **** <-- the number shud be the MODEL ID. when you put the models in the map model.

DONT use ::add model **** just add model ****

Read full topic
